body_html:
Yes, screenshots are from Chrome.

The button to show the actual size is nice, but IMO it would be better if the stretching didn't occur, or at least was controlled with max-height: 50vh or something because width: 100% really goes bonkers with height: auto. For example, this slice of a spectrogram stretches from 62x672 to 340x3685 pixels on my 1080p display in Chrome.

Could we at least control the number of columns or something with a slider?

For example, this slice of a spectrogram stretches from 62x672 to 340x3685 pixels on my 1080p display in Chrome.

body:
Yes, screenshots are from Chrome.

The button to show the actual size is nice, but IMO it would be better if the stretching didn't occur, or at least was controlled with `max-height: 50vh` or something because `width: 100%` really goes bonkers with `height: auto`. For example, [this slice of a spectrogram](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1595907/21936675/62e87a70-d9b2-11e6-8040-93af926bb6bd.png) stretches from 62x672 to 340x3685 pixels on my 1080p display in Chrome.

Could we at least control the number of columns or something with a slider?
